overview_of_class:
Introduction to the issues reporters face in covering war, terrorism, military conflicts and military-mediated disasters of various kinds. A natural disaster of the scope of Katrina, for example, demands military logistics and support, and creates reporting challenges unique to such situations. Field trips typically go to the Marine training facility in Quantico or elsewhere. Enrollment in this class usually capped at 15.

Priority enrollment is given to students studying in DC for their third or fourth quarters.
